FEB200206-d-02-20-02-PTRA.Narrative: JOB 251 CAME OUT OF NORTH YARD TRACK 8 WITH 19 CARS TO BE SWITCHED.  JOB 251 HAD CARS TO BE SWITCHEDTO TRACK 14.  THEY FIRST SHOVED THEIR TRAIN OF 19 CARS INTO THE SOUTH END OF TRACK 14 TO MAKE A BUMPER IN TRACK TO SWITCH AGAINST.  HELPER CAUGHT END OF LEADING CAR OF THEIR SHOVING MOVEMENT AS THEYSHOVED NORTH INTO TRACK 14.  HELPER GAVE INCORRECT CAR COUNT FOR SHOVING MOVEMENT AND THE ENGINEER FAILED TO STOP HIS MOVEMENT WITHIN ONE-HALF DISTANCE SPECIFIED UPON RECEIVING NO FURTHER COMMUNICATION.  THIS RESULTED IN JOB 251 NOT BEING ABLE TO STOP BEFORE SHOVING OUT NORTH END OF TRACK 14 AND RUNNING INTO SIDE OF UP TRAIN YEW70 WHICH WAS DRAGGING NORTH OUT OF TRACK 13 AT THE TIME.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

FEB01602-d-02-08-02-IC.Narrative: CREW SHOVED RACX 82268 INTO PELRON TRACK, THEN PULLED OPIX 382 TO REPLACE WITH RACX 82268. ONCE SWITCH WAS MADE AND CARS WERE SPOTTED, CREW SEPARATED CARS AND LEFT OPIX 382 STANDING ALONE. CREW PUT OPIX 382 INTO EMERGENCY AND DEPARTED WITH LIGHT ENGINES TO WOBBLEY INDUSTRIAL LEAD AND CREW CHANGED ENDS ON LOCOMOTIVE. IT APPEARS THAT UNIDENTIFIED PERSON(S) BLED AIR OFF CAR WHICH ALLOWED IT TO ROLL OUT OF TRACK, STRIKING AND DERAILING ENGINES AND TURNING OPIX CAR ON SIDE. ENGINE SUSTAINED RUPTUREDFUEL TANK BUT THERE WAS NO RELEASE ACCOUNT RUPTURE OCCURRED ABOVE FUEL LINE. FOLLOWING FORMAL INVESTIGATION, CONDUCTOR AND BRAKEMAN WERE BOTH ASSESSED 10 DAY DEFERED SUSPENSION FOR VIOLATION OF USOR RULE 713. PELRON DECLINED TO PARTICIPATE IN INVESTIGATION.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
